DOC.brief_summary: The investigator test novel surgical device facilitate safe circumcision among adult male . The investigator hypothesize device allow non-medical provider perform safe surgical circumcision without adverse event .
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : To conduct proof-of-concept study determine potential utility novel , adjustable single-visit , disposable device facilitate rapid adult circumcision . Design : Prospective pilot trial novel surgical device Setting : Tertiary care Veterans Administration medical center Patients : 5 adult male Interventions : Circumcisions perform junior trainee use adjustable , single-size surgical-assist device construct University Washington Applied Physics Laboratory . Main Outcome Measure ( ) : The attend surgeon trainee complete standardized form procedure assess technical problem ease use . Follow-up visit schedule evaluate adverse event , post-operative pain , cosmetic outcome participant satisfaction 3 , 8 , 30 90 day post-operatively .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion 1 . Uncircumcised male 2 . Aged > 18 3 . Sexually active 4 . No plan move next 6 month 5 . Consent participate Exclusion 1 . History bleed disorder 2 . History document concurrent STI appearance STI initial physical exam 3 . Keloid formation condition might unduly increase risk elective surgery 4 . Asprin , anticoagulants clinical contraindication
